required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BMS-790052 (Daclatasvir) Plus Peg-Interferon Alfa-2a and Ribavirin in Treatment-Naive Black/African-Americans, Latinos and White/Caucasians With Hepatitis C
clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label, Single Arm Evaluation of BMS-790052 (Daclatasvir) in Combination With Peg-Interferon Alfa-2a and Ribavirin in Black-African Americans, Latinos and White-Caucasians With Chronic Hepatitis C Genotype 1 Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the rates of sustained virologic response in each cohort (Black-African Americans, Latinos) in this study to historical rate.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virologic Response at Post-treatment Week 12 (SVR12)
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA levels <lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ), (target detected or target not detected) at Post-treatment Week 12. The limit of detection for HCV RNA was 10 IU/mL and the LLOQ was 25 IU/mL. For analysis purpose, participants were assigned to following 3 race/ethnicity cohorts: Black/African American, Latino, and White non-Latino. Some participants were represented in more than one race/ethnicity cohort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virologic Response at Post-treatment Week 12 (SVR12) With rs12979860 Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms at Baseline in the Interleukin-28B Gene
secondary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA levels <lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ), (target detected or target not detected) at Post-treatment Week 12. The limit of detection for HCV RNA was 10 IU/mL and the LLOQ was 25 IU/mL. For analysis purpose, participants were assigned to following 3 race/ethnicity cohorts: Black/African American, Latino, and White non-Latino. Some participants were represented in more than one race/ethnicity cohort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA Levels <Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLOQ), Target Detected or Target Not Detected, at Specified Time Points
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12; both Weeks 4 and 12; end-of-treatment (up to 48 weeks), or post-treatment Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The limit of detection for HCV RNA levels was 10 IU/mL and the LLOQ was 25 IU/mL. Data for post-treatment Weeks 36 and 48 were based on participants who had achieved virologic response (defined as HCV RNA levels <LLOQ, target not detected) at both Weeks 4 and 12, and completed 24 weeks of study treatment. For analysis purpose, participants were assigned to following 3 race/ethnicity cohorts: Black/African American, Latino, and White non-Latino. Some participants were represented in more than one race/ethnicity cohort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA Levels <Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLOQ), Target Not Detected, at Specified Time Points
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12; both Weeks 4 and 12; end-of-treatment (up to 48 weeks), or post-treatment Weeks 12 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: The limit of detection for HCV RNA levels was 10 IU/mL and the LLOQ was 25 IU/mL. For analysis purpose, participants were assigned to following 3 race/ethnicity cohorts: Black/African American, Latino, and White non-Latino. Some participants were represented in more than one race/ethnicity cohort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Treatment-related AEs, and Who Died
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to last dose plus 7 days (treatment period [TP]) through 48 weeks after the end of TP (follow-up period [FUP])
secondary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalization. Treatment-related AE was defined as an AE that had certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug. For analysis purpose, participants were assigned to following 4 race/ethnicity cohorts: Black/African American, White/Caucasian, Latino and Non-Latino. Some participants were represented in more than one race/ethnicity cohort.

intervention.description: Tablet, Oral, 60 mg, once daily, 24 weeks
Syringe, Subcutaneous Injection, 180 μg, Once weekly, 24 or 48 weeks depending on response
Tablet, Oral, 1000 or 1200 mg based on weight, Twice daily, 24 or 48 weeks depending on response

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants chronically infected with Hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 1
- HCV RNA viral load of ≥10,000 IU/mL at screening
- No previous exposure to interferon formulation, ribavirin or HCV direct antiviral agent
- Self-described as Black-African American, Latino or White-Caucasian
- Results of a liver biopsy obtained ≤36 months prior to first treatment compensated cirrhotics with HCV liver biopsy from any time prior to first treatment.
Compensated cirrhotics were capped at approximately 25%
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of decompensated liver disease
- Documented or suspected Hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)
- Positive for Hepatitis B or HIV 1/HIV 2 antibody at screening

facility.name: University Of California, Davis Medical Center
South Florida Center Of Gastroenterology, P.A.
University Of North Carolina At Chapel Hill School Of Med
Mcguire D V A M C

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 33 clinical sites in United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 448 participants were enrolled, and 246 entered treatment period. Remaining 202 did not enter treatment period (29: withdrew consent, 17: lost to follow-up, 156: no longer met study criteria). As per protocol, any participant who discontinued the treatment period was still expected to enter the post-treatment follow-up period.

group.title: Daclatasvir + Pegylated-interferon Alfa 2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Participants received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) 60 mg tablet orally once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg/0.5 mL subcutaneously once weekly, and ribavirin 1000 mg per day for those weighing <75 kg or 1200 mg per day for those weighing ≥75 kg for a period of 24 weeks. Participants who achieved a virologic response (Hepatitis C Virus RNA undetectable at both Weeks 4 and 12) completed therapy at Week 24 and were followed for 48 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Participants who did not achieve the virologic response, continued to receive pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin for additional 24 weeks (total treatment duration of 48 weeks), and were followed for 24 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and adverse events.

participants_list.participants: Out of 246 participants who entered the treatment period, 221 continued in the follow-up period.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Follow-up no longer needed per protocol

group.title: Daclatasvir + Pegylated-interferon Alfa 2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Participants received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) 60 mg tablet orally once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg/0.5 mL subcutaneously once weekly, and ribavirin 1000 mg per day for those weighing <75 kg or 1200 mg per day for those weighing ≥75 kg for a period of 24 weeks. Participants who achieved a virologic response (Hepatitis C Virus RNA undetectable at both Weeks 4 and 12) completed therapy at Week 24 and were followed for 48 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Participants who did not achieve the virologic response, continued to receive pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin for additional 24 weeks (total treatment duration of 48 weeks), and were followed for 24 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and adverse events.

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: rs12979860 Single Nucleotide Polymorphism in the Interleukin-28B Gene

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virologic Response at Post-treatment Week 12 (SVR12)
outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA levels <lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ), (target detected or target not detected) at Post-treatment Week 12. The limit of detection for HCV RNA was 10 IU/mL and the LLOQ was 25 IU/mL. For analysis purpose, participants were assigned to following 3 race/ethnicity cohorts: Black/African American, Latino, and White non-Latino. Some participants were represented in more than one race/ethnicity cohort.
outcome.population: All treated participants. Modified intent-to-treat analysis (participants meeting the response criteria / all treated participants) was performed for Black/African American and Latino cohorts.

group.title: Black/African American Cohort
group.description: Participants belonging to Black/African American race, received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) 60 mg tablet orally once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg/0.5 mL subcutaneously once weekly, and ribavirin 1000 mg per day for those weighing <75 kg or 1200 mg per day for those weighing ≥75 kg for a period of 24 weeks. Participants who achieved a virologic response (HCV RNA undetectable at both Weeks 4 and 12) completed therapy at Week 24 and were followed for 48 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Participants who did not achieve the virologic response, continued to receive pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin for additional 24 weeks (total treatment duration of 48 weeks), and were followed for 24 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and adverse events (AEs). This cohort included Latino and Non-Latino participants.

group.title: Latino Cohort
group.description: Participants belonging to Latino ethnicity, received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) 60 mg tablet orally once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg/0.5 mL subcutaneously once weekly, and ribavirin 1000 mg per day for those weighing <75 kg or 1200 mg per day for those weighing ≥75 kg for a period of 24 weeks. Participants who achieved a virologic response (HCV RNA undetectable at both Weeks 4 and 12) completed therapy at Week 24 and were followed for 48 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Participants who did not achieve the virologic response, continued to receive pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin for additional 24 weeks (total treatment duration of 48 weeks), and were followed for 24 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and AEs. This cohort included White/Caucasian and Black/African American participants.

group.title: White Non-Latino Cohort
group.description: Participants belonging to White race and Non-Latino ethnicity, received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) 60 mg tablet orally once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg/0.5 mL subcutaneously once weekly, and ribavirin 1000 mg per day for those weighing <75 kg or 1200 mg per day for those weighing ≥75 kg for a period of 24 weeks. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and AEs.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Treatment-related AEs, and Who Died
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalization. Treatment-related AE was defined as an AE that had certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug. For analysis purpose, participants were assigned to following 4 race/ethnicity cohorts: Black/African American, White/Caucasian, Latino and Non-Latino. Some participants were represented in more than one race/ethnicity cohort.
outcome.time_frame: From first dose to last dose plus 7 days (treatment period [TP]) through 48 weeks after the end of TP (follow-up period [FUP])
outcome.population: All treated participants for TP and all follow-up participants for FUP. Here, "n" signifies the number of participants evaluable in their respective study periods.

group.title: Black/African American Cohort
group.description: Participants belonging to Black/African American race, received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) 60 mg tablet orally once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg/0.5 mL subcutaneously once weekly, and ribavirin 1000 mg per day for those weighing <75 kg or 1200 mg per day for those weighing ≥75 kg for a period of 24 weeks. Participants who achieved a virologic response (HCV RNA undetectable at both Weeks 4 and 12) completed therapy at Week 24 and were followed for 48 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Participants who did not achieve the virologic response, continued to receive pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin for additional 24 weeks (total treatment duration of 48 weeks), and were followed for 24 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and AEs. This cohort included Latino and Non-Latino participants.

group.title: White/Caucasian Cohort
group.description: Participants belonging to White/Caucasian race, received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) tablets 60 mg orally, once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg per 0.5 mL subcutaneously, once weekly, and ribavirin tablets 800 mg orally, twice daily, for 24 weeks (for participants who had achieved the virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12) to 48 weeks (for participants who did not achieve the virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12). For participants weighing <75 kg, the total dose of ribavirin was 1000 mg per day and for those weighing ≥75 kg, the dose was 1200 mg per day. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and AEs. This cohort included Latino and Non-Latino participants.

group.title: Latino Cohort
group.description: Participants belonging to Latino ethnicity, received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) 60 mg tablet orally once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg/0.5 mL subcutaneously once weekly, and ribavirin 1000 mg per day for those weighing <75 kg or 1200 mg per day for those weighing ≥75 kg for a period of 24 weeks. Participants who achieved a virologic response (HCV RNA undetectable at both Weeks 4 and 12) completed therapy at Week 24 and were followed for 48 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Participants who did not achieve the virologic response, continued to receive pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin for additional 24 weeks (total treatment duration of 48 weeks), and were followed for 24 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and AEs. This cohort included White/Caucasian and Black/African American participants.

group.title: Non-Latino Cohort
group.description: Participants belonging to Non-Latino ethnicity, received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) tablets 60 mg orally, once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg per 0.5 mL subcutaneously, once weekly, and ribavirin tablets 800 mg orally, twice daily, for 24 weeks (for participants who had achieved the virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12) to 48 weeks (for participants who did not achieve the virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12). For participants weighing <75 kg, the total dose of ribavirin was 1000 mg per day and for those weighing ≥75 kg, the dose was 1200 mg per day. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and AEs. This cohort included White/Caucasian and Black/African American participants.

group.title: Overall Population
group.description: Participants received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) tablets 60 mg orally, once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg per 0.5 mL subcutaneously, once weekly, and ribavirin tablets 800 mg orally, twice daily, for 24 weeks (for participants who had achieved the virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12) to 48 weeks (for participants who did not achieve the virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12). For participants weighing <75 kg, the total dose of ribavirin was 1000 mg per day and for those weighing ≥75 kg, the dose was 1200 mg per day. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and AEs.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Treatment-related AEs, and Who Died
measure.description: An AE was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity; was life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required or prolonged hospitalization. Treatment-related AE was defined as an AE that had certain, probable, possible, or unknown relationship to study drug. For analysis purpose, participants were assigned to following 4 race/ethnicity cohorts: Black/African American, White/Caucasian, Latino and Non-Latino. Some participants were represented in more than one race/ethnicity cohort.
measure.population: All treated participants for TP and all follow-up participants for FUP. Here, "n" signifies the number of participants evaluable in their respective study periods.

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose to 7 days post last dose of study treatment

group.title: Daclatasvir + Pegylated-interferon Alfa 2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Participants received daclatasvir (BMS-790052) 60 mg tablet orally once daily, along with pegylated-interferon alfa 2a solution for injection 180 μg/0.5 mL subcutaneously once weekly, and ribavirin 1000 mg per day for those weighing <75 kg or 1200 mg per day for those weighing ≥75 kg for a period of 24 weeks. Participants who achieved a virologic response (Hepatitis C Virus RNA undetectable at both Weeks 4 and 12) completed therapy at Week 24 and were followed for 48 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Participants who did not achieve the virologic response, continued to receive pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin for additional 24 weeks (total treatment duration of 48 weeks), and were followed for 24 weeks of post-treatment follow-up. Dose modifications to pegylated-interferon alfa 2a and ribavirin were allowed to manage tolerability and adverse events.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
